attachments.text: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.
attachments.fallback: Imgur: When you see your customizable character in a cutscene

text: oh <!here>! I need to tell you that a Retro Game Night is happening tonight, and every other Monday at my friend Chris's apartment in the Lloyd district. We play retro (and new) games on many screens, share beverages and snacks, and donate to progressive charities. Tonight's for the NAACP Legal Defense Fund, and it goes from 5:30-whenever. I'll be heading there after work today, if anyone wants to come along. And I'll give more notice next time :sweat_smile:
oh what, that is right next to where i live. Im going to be busy tonight :confused: but I will totally go one of these days.
Typically busy playing M:TG on Monday nights but I'm sure I can skip every now and then for something equally awesome and nerdy.
can't this week but appreciate the heads-up! It's awesome you're handling donations

Oh, I am not handling donations, the event host (Chris) does. I like his way of doing things. There's a tally system where showing up and bringing a (beverage/snack/friend) to RGN results in $1 being donated to the nonprofit of the event. Today we'll also be contributing toward the Humble Freedom Bundle benefiting the ACLU :money_mouth_face:  <https://www.humblebundle.com/freedom>

attachments.title: Humble Freedom Bundle
attachments.text: Join Humble in supporting the ACLU, the IRC, and MSF with this epic lineup of games!

text: damn are those good games in that bundle
is amazing... as if I needed any more reasons to like Humble Bundle
now if i had enough time to play those games

bit busy working on building my handheld game consoles. Im nearly done with my pi3 based one, having issues with the thumb sticks. the ones i got from adafruit have soooo much noise on the lines im not sure why, they jump around like crazy and retro pie thinks you are using them when you are not, switched to psp thumbsticks they nearly work, still not completely registering right, but close

also picked up a C64 DTV device which is actually a full commodore 64 on a small board, with complete iec interface and i have a sd2iec, so i can load games to it off sd card. in effect im building my own C64 handheld game console. that will play games off sd card. this will check off a childhood dream haha
would really like to build this failed kickstarter <https://c1.iggcdn.com/indiegogo-media-prod-cld/image/upload/c_limit,f_auto,w_620/v1460641729/uhhfu70bqunqw04g7n4a.jpg>
have everything i need now, starting on wiring and case design next
